intro: Barleria acanthoides, commonly known as the African daisy or barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy clusters of pink or red flowers, which bloom from spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Barleria acanthoides is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
